member.name: T:Spring.Web.Services.WebServiceProxyFactory
member.summary: Factory Object that dynamically implements service interface for web service.

remarks.p: This factory object should be used to obtain reference to a web service that can be safely cast to a service interface, which allows client code to code against interface, and not directly against the web service.
The WSDL contract needs to conform to WS-I Basic Profiles.

member.author: Bruno Baia
Aleksandar Seovic

member.name: F:Spring.Web.Services.WebServiceProxyFactory.proxyConstructor
member.summary: The web service proxy default constructor.

member.summary: Gets or sets the url of the proxy server to use for retrieving the WSDL.

remarks.p: This only applies when using an as uri.
The default is to use the system proxy setting.

member.summary: Gets or sets the instance to use when connecting to a proxy server that requires authentication.

remarks.p: This only applies when using an as uri.

member.summary: Gets or sets a list of custom attributes that should be applied to a proxy class.

member.name: P:Spring.Web.Services.WebServiceProxyFactory.MemberAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary of custom attributes that should be applied to web service members.
member.remarks: Dictionary key is an expression that members can be matched against. Value is a list of attributes that should be applied to each member that matches expression.

member.summary: Gets the mapping of the interface to proxy into the actual methods on the target type that does not need to implement that interface.

remarks.p: As the proxy type does not implement the interface, we try to find matching methods.

member.returns: An interface mapping for the interface to proxy.

member.name: T:Spring.Remoting.SaoFactoryObject
member.summary: Factory for creating a reference to a remote server activated object (SAO).
member.remarks: This is useful alternative to adminstrative type registration on the client when you would like the client to have only a reference to the interface that an SAO implements and not the actual SAO implentation.
member.author: Aleksandar Seovic
Mark Pollack
Bruno Baia

member.name: T:Spring.Remoting.Config.RemotingNamespaceParser
member.summary: Implementation of the custom configuration parser for remoting definitions.
member.author: Bruno Baia

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Spring.Remoting.Config.RemotingNamespaceParser.ParseElement(System.Xml.XmlElement,Spring.Objects.Factory.Xml.ParserContext)
member.summary: Parse the specified element and register any resulting IObjectDefinitions with the IObjectDefinitionRegistry that is embedded in the supplied ParserContext.
member.param: The element to be parsed into one or more IObjectDefinitions
The object encapsulating the current state of the parsing process.
member.returns: The primary IObjectDefinition (can be null as explained above)
member.remarks:
Implementations should return the primary IObjectDefinition that results from the parse phase if they wish to used nested inside (for example) a <property> tag.
Implementations may return null if they will not be used in a nested scenario.

member.summary: Parses remoting definitions.
member.param: The name of the object definition.

member.name: T:Spring.Remoting.Support.BaseRemoteObject
member.summary: This class extends to allow users to define object lifecycle details by simply setting its properties.

remarks.p: Remoting exporters uses this class as a base proxy class in order to support lifecycle configuration when exporting a remote object.

member.author: Aleksandar Seovic

member.name: M:Spring.Remoting.Support.BaseRemoteObject.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Spring.Remoting.Support.BaseRemoteObject.InitializeLifetimeService
member.summary: Obtains a lifetime service object to control the lifetime policy for this instance.

remarks.p: This method uses property values to configure for this object.

It is very much inspired by Ingo Rammer's example in Chapter 6 of "Advanced .NET Remoting", but is modified slightly to make it more "Spring-friendly". Basically, the main difference is that instead of pulling lease configuration from the .NET config file, this implementation relies on Spring DI to get appropriate values injected, which makes it much more flexible.

member.returns: An object of type used to control the lifetime policy for this instance. This is the current lifetime service object for this instance if one exists; otherwise, a new lifetime service object initialized to the value of the property.
member.exception: The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.Support.BaseRemoteObject.IsInfinite
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance has infinite lifetime.
member.value: if this instance has infinite lifetime; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.Support.BaseRemoteObject.InitialLeaseTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial lease time.

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.Support.BaseRemoteObject.RenewOnCallTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time lease should be extended for on each call to this object.
member.value: The amount of time lease should be extended for on each call to this object.

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.Support.BaseRemoteObject.SponsorshipTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time lease manager will for this object's sponsors to respond.
member.value: The amount of time lease manager will for this object's sponsors to respond.

member.name: T:Spring.Remoting.Support.ICaoRemoteFactory
member.summary: Interface for a CAO based object factory.

remarks.p: Provides a well known location for clients to retrieve references to CAO references.

member.author: Aleksandar Seovic
Mark Pollack
Bruno Baia

member.name: M:Spring.Remoting.Support.ICaoRemoteFactory.GetObject
member.summary: Returns the CAO proxy.

member.name: M:Spring.Remoting.Support.ICaoRemoteFactory.GetObject(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns the CAO proxy using the argument list to call the constructor.
member.remarks: The matching of arguments to call the constructor is done by type. The alternative ways, by index and by constructor name are not supported.
member.param: Constructor arguments used to create the object.

member.name: T:Spring.Remoting.SaoExporter

member.remarks: Object can be exported either as SingleCall or Singleton.

Mark Pollack
Bruno Baia

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the remote application.

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.SaoExporter.ServiceName
member.summary:
Gets or sets the name of the exported remote service.
The name that will be used in the URI to refer to this service. This will be of the form, tcp://host:port/ServiceName or tcp://host:port/ApplicationName/ServiceName

member.summary: Gets or sets the list of interfaces whose methods should be exported.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is all the interfaces implemented or inherited by the target type.

member.summary: Gets or sets the that this object runs in.

member.summary: Sets object factory to use.

member.name: T:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter
member.summary: Encapsulates information necessary to create ServicedComponent wrapper around target class.

remarks.p: Instances of this class should be used as elements in the Components list of the class, which will register them with COM+ Services.

member.author: Aleksandar Seovic

member.name: M:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.AfterPropertiesSet
member.summary: Validate configuration.

member.name: M:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.CreateWrapperType(System.Reflection.Emit.ModuleBuilder,Spring.Objects.Factory.IObjectFactory)
member.summary: Creates ServicedComponent wrapper around target class.
member.param: Object factory to get target from.

member.name: P:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.TargetName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the target object that should be exposed as a serviced component.

member.name: P:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.Interfaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of interfaces whose methods should be exported.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is all the interfaces implemented or inherited by the target type.

member.name: P:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.TypeAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of custom attributes that should be applied to a proxy class.

member.name: P:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.MemberAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary of custom attributes that should be applied to proxy members.
member.remarks: Map key is an expression that members can be matched against. Value is a list of attributes that should be applied to each member that matches expression.

member.name: P:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentExporter.ObjectName
member.summary: Set the name of the object in the object factory that created this object.

member.summary: Initializes factory object.

member.summary: Creates new instance of the remotable target proxy.

member.summary: Gets or sets the target object.

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.RemoteObjectFactory.BaseType
member.summary: Gets or sets the class or subclass that the proxy must inherit from.

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.RemoteObjectFactory.Interfaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of interfaces to wrap.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is all the interfaces implemented or inherited by the target type.

member.summary: Returns type of the remotable target proxy.

member.name: P:Spring.Remoting.RemoteObjectFactory.IsSingleton
member.summary: Always returns false.

member.name: T:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentFactory
member.summary: Factory Object that instantiates and configures ServicedComponent.

remarks.p: This factory object should be used to instantiate and configure serviced components created by .

member.author: Aleksandar Seovic

member.summary: Creates new instance of serviced component factory.

member.summary: Initializes factory object.

member.summary: Creates new instance of serviced component.

member.summary: Gets or sets component name, as registered with COM+ Services.

member.summary: Gets or sets name of the remote server that COM+ component is registered with.

member.name: P:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentFactory.ObjectType
member.summary: Returns type of serviced component.

member.name: P:Spring.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponentFactory.IsSingleton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether serviced component should be treated as singleton. Default is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template object definition that should be used to configure proxy instance.
